name: Colombia
description: Colombia, officially the Republic of Colombia, is a country in northwestern South America. Known as the 'Land of Coffee' and the 'Emerald of the Continent,' it boasts incredible biodiversity, stunning landscapes ranging from the Andes Mountains to the Amazon rainforest, and a rich cultural heritage shaped by indigenous, Spanish, and African influences.  Its diverse geography contributes to a wide array of climates and ecosystems, making it a truly remarkable destination.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Colombia is the world's 12th largest country by area.
quickFacts.detail: This vast expanse encompasses diverse terrains, from coastal plains to high-altitude plateaus.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Colombia has a dynamic and growing population.
quickFacts.detail: The population is distributed unevenly, with a higher concentration in urban areas.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: Bogotá is the bustling capital and largest city.
quickFacts.detail: Located in the Andes Mountains, it's known for its vibrant culture and historical significance.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: Spanish is the primary language spoken throughout the country.
quickFacts.detail: Indigenous languages are also spoken in various regions.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: The Colombian Peso is the official currency.
quickFacts.detail: Exchange rates fluctuate, so it's wise to check current rates before traveling.

quickFacts.label: GDP
quickFacts.detail: Key sectors include agriculture, manufacturing, and services.

climateData.title: Colombia's Diverse Climate
climateData.description: Colombia experiences a wide range of climates due to its varied topography and latitude. From tropical rainforests to temperate highlands, the country offers distinct seasonal variations.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Wet Season (May - October)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: This season is characterized by heavy rainfall, particularly in the Caribbean and Pacific coasts, and the Amazon basin.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Dry Season (November - April)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The dry season brings sunshine and lower humidity, making it ideal for outdoor activities.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Cool Season (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Temperatures drop in the Andes Mountains, creating a cool and refreshing climate.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Warm Season (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Warm temperatures prevail across the country, with the Amazon region experiencing its warmest months.

naturalWonders.name: Amazon Rainforest
naturalWonders.description: The Amazon Rainforest, spanning parts of Colombia, Brazil, Peru, and other South American countries, is the world's largest tropical rainforest. It's a biodiversity hotspot, home to countless plant and animal species.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The Amazon River, the world's second-longest river, flows through the heart of the rainforest, supporting a complex ecosystem. Indigenous communities have lived in harmony with the forest for centuries.
naturalWonders.bestTime: Year-round, but the dry season (December-April) offers easier access to trails.

scientificData.Biodiversity: Estimated 10% of the world's known species

naturalWonders.name: Tayrona National Natural Park
naturalWonders.description: Located on Colombia's Caribbean coast, Tayrona National Park is a stunning coastal paradise with pristine beaches, lush rainforests, and dramatic cliffs.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The park protects a unique ecosystem where the rainforest meets the sea. It's a haven for wildlife, including monkeys, sloths, and various bird species. The park's beaches are renowned for their beauty and tranquility.

naturalWonders.name: Los Nevados National Natural Park
naturalWonders.description: Los Nevados National Natural Park is a majestic mountain range in the Colombian Andes, characterized by its snow-capped peaks, glaciers, and volcanic activity.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The park offers incredible opportunities for mountaineering, trekking, and wildlife viewing. It's home to the Paramillo Volcano, one of Colombia's most iconic peaks. The park's diverse ecosystems range from alpine tundra to cloud forests.

biodiversityCategory.name: Orchid Diversity
biodiversityCategory.description: Colombia is a global hotspot for orchid diversity, boasting an estimated 2,000 native species.

statistics.details: The highest concentration of orchid species in the world.
Orchids are found in a wide range of habitats, from cloud forests to coastal mangroves.

notableSpecies.name: Cattleya violacea
notableSpecies.significance: A stunning purple orchid found in the cloud forests of the Andes.

notableSpecies.name: Masdevallia spp.
notableSpecies.significance: A diverse group of miniature orchids known for their vibrant colors and unique shapes.

ecosystemData.title: Colombian Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Colombia's diverse geography supports a wide range of ecosystems, including rainforests, grasslands, wetlands, and mountains.

biodiversityCategories.name: Amazonian Ecosystem
biodiversityCategories.description: The Amazon rainforest covers a significant portion of Colombia, playing a crucial role in global climate regulation.

statistics.details: Colombia's portion of the Amazon rainforest.
The Amazon River and its tributaries are vital for transportation and biodiversity.

notableSpecies.name: Jaguar
notableSpecies.significance: A top predator in the Amazon rainforest.

notableSpecies.name: Giant Otter
notableSpecies.significance: The largest otter species in the world.

activities.title: Outdoor Activities in Colombia
activities.description: Colombia offers a diverse range of outdoor activities for all levels of experience.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore Colombia's stunning landscapes on foot.

activities.name: Lost City Trek
activities.description: A challenging trek through the jungle to reach the ancient ruins of Ciudad Perdida.
activities.requirements: Good physical fitness, hiking boots, insect repellent

activities.name: Cocora Valley Hike
activities.description: Hike through the stunning Cocora Valley, home to the world's tallest palm trees.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy Colombia's beautiful coastlines with a variety of water sports.

activities.name: Surfing
activities.description: Catch some waves on Colombia's Pacific coast.
